result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith E Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
As to count 1:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees(including DNA) by 04/21/2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment
- Provide a DNA sample.
Restitution in the amount of $86 to the Owner of Reflections Jewelry Firdais C.
Court order 20 days to file a notice of right to seek postconviction relief. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees(including DNA, and Restitution) by 04/21/2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment
Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Keith E Sanders in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Keith E Sanders in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
As to count 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Contacted Attorney Michael Jude to reschedule Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing scheduled April 21, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. Defendant was not produced from Green Bay Correctional-Per Assistant District Attorney Jennifer Pickett.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31 on May 4, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Keith E Sanders not in court, in custody and not produced.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. 

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Craig and Marion SA. or Reflections Jewelry at 1306 W Forest Home Ave., Milwaukee

Defendant Keith E Sanders in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Keith E Sanders in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rifelj, Branch 31.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Letter received from in-custody defendant, Winnebago Resource Center, who is requesting warrant be resolved.   Copy of letter forwarded to Jan Kriner, DA's Office, for action.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
